thread.title: Biden's family 'totally on board' with White House run
thread.title_full: Biden's family 'totally on board' with White House run | Washington Examiner

author: Curt Mills
title: Biden's family 'totally on board' with White House run
text:
The family of Vice President Joe Biden would support his decision to run for president should he enter the race, although Biden has still not made a decision yet two days after the first Democratic debate.
The impression around those close to him is that he would forever regret not taking one last stab at the presidency, his life's ambition, CNN reported .
"His family is totally on board," said one Democrat who spoke to Biden this week.
Related Story: http://www.washingtonexaminer.com/article/2574118/ That report came out just a day after many pundits started arguing that it might be too late for Biden to enter the race, after Hillary Clinton's strong debate performance on Tuesday.
  Bush and Rubio squabble while Trump runs away with it After Bush announced his fundraising total, his campaign started a spat with Rubio over who did better.
By Byron York • 10/16/15 6:19 AM But the White House has maintained that her performance will not affect his decision , and Biden has reportedly been fielding calls to donors and potential staffers in the early voting states, even after Tuesday.
Top Story RNC chair: Republicans are 'cooked' if defeated in 2016 The Republican Party has become a "a midterm party" that struggles with the presidential elections.
By Al Weaver • 10/16/15 12:01 AM
